
## Downsample gaze data {.unnumbered}


### Description

This function combines gaze samples into time bins and optionally aggregates the data.



### Usage

<pre><code class='language-R'>downsample_gaze(
  dataframe,
  bin.length = 50,
  timevar = "time",
  aggvars = c("subject", "condition", "target", "trial", "object", "time_bin")
)
</code></pre>


### Arguments

<table>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="dataframe">dataframe</code></td>
<td>
DataFrame containing gaze data.
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="bin.length">bin.length</code></td>
<td>
Length of time bins (in milliseconds).
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="timevar">timevar</code></td>
<td>
Column name representing time.
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="aggvars">aggvars</code></td>
<td>
Vector of variable names to group by for aggregation. Use &quot;none&quot; to skip aggregation.
</td></tr>
</table>


### Value

DataFrame with time bins added and optionally aggregated data.
